required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Human Amniotic Epithelial Cells Prevent Acute Graft-versus-host Disease After Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Single Arm Clinical Study of Human Amniotic Epithelial Cells in Preventing Acute Graft-versus-host Disease After Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation

collaborator.agency: Shanghai iCELL Biotechnology Co., Ltd, Shanghai, China

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Single arm clinical study evaluating the safety and efficacy of hAECs in preventing aGVHD after HSCT.

detailed_description.textblock: A dose escalation study evaluating the safety and efficacy of human amniotic epithelial cells( hAECs) in preventing acute graft-versus-host(aGVHD) disease after hematopoietic stem cell transplantation(HSCT). The doses were 1×10^6、2×10^6、5×^6 cell/kg, successively.

primary_outcome.description: Safety of HSCT combined with hAECs infusion;

secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of Graft-versus-host disease after hAECs infusion

arm_group.description: Infusion of hAECs at the day before HSCT and 7th days after HSCT. The dose is 1×10^6, 2×10^6, 5×10^6 cell/kg, successively.
